alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 01 at 3:03PM EDT until October 02 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one foot of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the Coastal Flood Watch, one to two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the Beach Hazards Statement, a high risk for rip currents. * WHERE...Accomack County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 5 PM EDT this afternoon. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from late Sunday night through Monday evening. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions expected. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SAXIS VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.0 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 01/04 PM 4.5 2.0 1.7 1 MINOR 02/05 AM 3.7 1.2 1.5 1 NONE 02/05 PM 3.8 1.3 1.1 2 NONE 03/06 AM 2.7 0.2 0.5 2 NONE 03/07 PM 3.8 1.3 1.1 2 NONE 04/08 AM 3.6 1.1 1.4 2 NONE NASSAWADOX CREEK AT BAYFORD VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 3.0 FT, MODERATE 3.5 FT, MAJOR 4.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.0 FT, MODERATE 1.5 FT, MAJOR 2.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 01/02 PM 3.5 1.5 1.6 1-2 MODERATE 02/02 AM 2.9 0.9 1.6 1 NONE 02/05 PM 3.5 1.5 1.7 2-4 MODERATE 03/05 AM 3.7 1.7 2.3 5-6 MODERATE 03/05 PM 4.3 2.3 2.4 6 MODERATE 04/05 AM 3.7 1.7 2.3 5 MODERATE CHINCOTEAGUE INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.2 FT, MAJOR 3.2 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/01 AM 2.6 -0.2 0.3 3 NONE 02/02 PM 4.2 1.4 1.1 1-2 NONE 03/02 AM 4.7 1.9 2.6 2 MINOR 03/03 PM 5.4 2.6 2.4 2-3 MODERATE 04/02 AM 4.1 1.3 2.2 3 NONE WACHAPREAGUE VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 6.5 FT, MODERATE 7.5 FT, MAJOR 8.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 01/02 PM 6.2 1.7 1.3 1 NONE 02/01 AM 4.9 0.4 1.1 1 NONE 02/02 PM 6.3 1.8 1.6 1 NONE 03/03 AM 6.9 2.4 3.1 1 MINOR 03/04 PM 7.9 3.4 3.2 1 MODERATE 04/04 AM 6.9 2.4 3.1 1 MINOR &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
